page.title: 17Field Sports around Bramdean
page.content: Pheasant shooting is quite important during the season. There are usually at least 3 syndicate or private shoots in the area every year. For syndicate shoots a fee is payable; people may travel considerable distances to join one of these shoots. The pheasants are bred in the area and released into the wild for shooting. Rabbits, pigeons and hares are also shot, there is no shortage of these in this area; it is likely they would become a considerable pest if they were not controlled in this way. Ferreting is also a pastime of some local people. The Ropley foxhounds hunt across the area, though they are based 4 miles away.
